title: URL slugs
user_story:
As a visitor\
Instead of a generic URL with an ID\
I want all NODE detail pages to be served via a human-readable URL\
So I can directly see which NODE hides behind a link, without needing to open it first
description:
* the goal is to create human-readable, seo-friendly and bookmark-friendly URLs
* scope: for now only NODE detail pages
* example:
  * before: `/companies/10000424`
  * after: `/ford-motor-company-10000424`
* the slug does not explicitly include information about the node type
  * it might be included in some case (e.g. `lap-time-1m-30.3s`), but that is **not** mandatory
* each existing link to a detail page is to be replaced by the slug versions (e.g. on the overview pages)
* the URL pattern is always: `/<slug>-<id>`
* in general, the slug is created from the name of the node 
  * but the code needs to be flexible enough to allow other properties to be the base (lap times for example have no name)
* slug conversion rules:
  * all characters to lower case
  * whitespaces are replaced by a hyphen
  * characters that are not allowed in an URL are removed or replaced (e.g. `ä` → `ae`)
* redirects are handled in a different ticket → <https://dennis-gerike.atlassian.net/browse/MCF-217>
